messages.subject: Tsuba question
messages.msgSnippet: Dear All, Can someone give me their opinion on the tsuba depicted in these pics? http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru1.jpg
messages.messageBody:
Dear All,

Can someone give me their opinion on the tsuba depicted in these pics?

http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru1.jpg
http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru2.jpg

The description is "Early edo period (circa 1650) tetsu (iron) tsuba for
katana, maru gata, (round shaped), ko-nara school, ("old" Nara)".

Do the pics match the description, especially as regards period and
school? Look authentic?

In advance, thanks. Sorry if this is a duplicate. I sent a similar one
this morning but never saw it come through.

Best Regards,

Andres Pedraza

messages.subject: Tsuba question
messages.msgSnippet: Can someone give me an opinion on this tsuba? The description states it is a Early edo period (circa 1650) tetsu (iron) tsuba for katana, maru gata, (round
messages.messageBody:
Can someone give me an opinion on this tsuba? The description states it
is a "Early edo period (circa 1650) tetsu (iron) tsuba for katana, maru
gata, (round shaped), ko-nara school, ("old" Nara)".

http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru1.jpg
http://www.angelfire.com/darkside/necromage/images/konaramaru2.jpg

Does it look legitimate for that description?

Thanks!

Best Regards,

Andres Pedraza
